channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Delta CEO warns Trump tariffs are already threatening the $300 billion revenge travel market: ‘We’re acting as if we’re going into a recession’
item.description: Bastian called Trump's tariffs "the wrong approach" as markets spiral.

item.title: Coalition Deal in Germany Clears Way for Friedrich Merz to Become Chancellor
item.description: The agreement was concluded relatively quickly but still took about six and half weeks, during which the country had been virtually rudderless at a cr...

item.title: Trump’s Tariff Goal Is to Eliminate Trade Deficits. Economists Have Doubts.
item.description: Behind Trump’s new tariffs is a goal that is as ambitious as it is unrealistic: eliminating the bilateral trade deficit with every U.S. trading partne...

item.title: Cathie Wood raises fears there are ‘serious liquidity issues in the U.S. banking system’ as Trump tariffs hit
item.description: As President Trump's tariffs took effect, the fund manager famous for her aggressive bets on Tesla is calling for a coordinated fiscal and monetary po...

item.title: Israeli Airstrike in Gaza City Leaves Many Dead, Health Officials There Say

item.title: Apple falls from world’s most valuable company spot
item.description: Shares are down 20% since Trump's Liberation Day.

item.title: The House Republicans Holding Out Against Trump’s Budget and Tax Cut Plan
item.description: Hard-line conservatives concerned about the deficit are among President Trump’s most stalwart supporters in Congress. But they say they cannot in good...

item.title: Walmart CEO Doug McMillon is a rare beacon of confidence amid tariff woes—and sees a chance to grab market share
item.description: "Nothing about the current environment impacts our confidence in our business or our strategy," McMillon said at the company's Investor Day.

item.title: Trump’s ‘Liberation Day’ tariffs are now in effect—and Asia is taking the hardest hit
item.description: Trump’s tariff rate on China now totals at least 104%, yet Chinese markets rose slightly on the promise of support from Beijing.

item.title: Is More Protein Better for You? Fact-Checking Claims on Social Media
item.description: It’s a common refrain on social media. We fact-checked this and five other big protein claims circulating online.

item.title: E.U. Officials Set to Vote Today on First Retaliatory Tariffs
item.description: The tariffs will take effect starting on April 15 and hit back at President Trump’s steel and aluminum levies. Further measures could come next.

item.title: Live Updates: China and Europe Hit Back as U.S. Tariffs Kick In
item.description: Stock markets wobbled, and turmoil spread to the bond market, after President Trump imposed a 104 percent tariff on Chinese goods and Beijing announce...

item.title: Scientists Map Miles of Wiring in a Speck of Mouse Brain
item.description: Scientists achieved “a milestone” by charting the activity and structure of 200,000 cells in a mouse brain and their 523 million connections.
